speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: SCENE IV. The same. Hall in the palace.

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: A banquet prepared. Enter MACBETH, LADY MACBETH, ROSS, LENNOX, Lords, and Attendants

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: You know your own degrees; sit down: at first

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And last the hearty welcome.

speaker: Lords
text_entry: Thanks to your majesty.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Ourself will mingle with society,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And play the humble host.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Our hostess keeps her state, but in best time

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We will require her welcome.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Pronounce it for me, sir, to all our friends;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: For my heart speaks they are welcome.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: First Murderer appears at the door

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: See, they encounter thee with their hearts' thanks.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Both sides are even: here I'll sit i' the midst:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Be large in mirth; anon we'll drink a measure

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The table round.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Approaching the door

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: There's blood on thy face.

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: 'Tis Banquo's then.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: 'Tis better thee without than he within.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Is he dispatch'd?

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: My lord, his throat is cut; that I did for him.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou art the best o' the cut-throats: yet he's good

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That did the like for Fleance: if thou didst it,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou art the nonpareil.

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: Most royal sir,

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: Fleance is 'scaped.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Then comes my fit again: I had else been perfect,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Whole as the marble, founded as the rock,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: As broad and general as the casing air:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But now I am cabin'd, cribb'd, confined, bound in

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To saucy doubts and fears. But Banquo's safe?

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: Ay, my good lord: safe in a ditch he bides,

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: With twenty trenched gashes on his head;

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: The least a death to nature.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thanks for that:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: There the grown serpent lies; the worm that's fled

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hath nature that in time will venom breed,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: No teeth for the present. Get thee gone: to-morrow

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We'll hear, ourselves, again.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exit Murderer

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: My royal lord,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: You do not give the cheer: the feast is sold

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That is not often vouch'd, while 'tis a-making,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: 'Tis given with welcome: to feed were best at home;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: From thence the sauce to meat is ceremony;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Meeting were bare without it.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Sweet remembrancer!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Now, good digestion wait on appetite,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And health on both!

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: May't please your highness sit.

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: The GHOST OF BANQUO enters, and sits in MACBETH's place

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Here had we now our country's honour roof'd,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Were the graced person of our Banquo present;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Who may I rather challenge for unkindness

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Than pity for mischance!

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: His absence, sir,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Lays blame upon his promise. Please't your highness

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: To grace us with your royal company.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The table's full.

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Here is a place reserved, sir.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Where?

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Here, my good lord. What is't that moves your highness?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which of you have done this?

speaker: Lords
text_entry: What, my good lord?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou canst not say I did it: never shake

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thy gory locks at me.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Gentlemen, rise: his highness is not well.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Sit, worthy friends: my lord is often thus,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And hath been from his youth: pray you, keep seat;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: The fit is momentary; upon a thought

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: He will again be well: if much you note him,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: You shall offend him and extend his passion:

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Feed, and regard him not. Are you a man?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Ay, and a bold one, that dare look on that

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which might appal the devil.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: O proper stuff!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: This is the very painting of your fear:

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: This is the air-drawn dagger which, you said,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Led you to Duncan. O, these flaws and starts,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Impostors to true fear, would well become

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: A woman's story at a winter's fire,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Authorized by her grandam. Shame itself!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Why do you make such faces? When all's done,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: You look but on a stool.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Prithee, see there! behold! look! lo!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: how say you?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Why, what care I? If thou canst nod, speak too.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If charnel-houses and our graves must send

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Those that we bury back, our monuments

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Shall be the maws of kites.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: GHOST OF BANQUO vanishes

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: What, quite unmann'd in folly?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If I stand here, I saw him.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Fie, for shame!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Blood hath been shed ere now, i' the olden time,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Ere human statute purged the gentle weal;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Ay, and since too, murders have been perform'd

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Too terrible for the ear: the times have been,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That, when the brains were out, the man would die,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And there an end; but now they rise again,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: With twenty mortal murders on their crowns,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And push us from our stools: this is more strange

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Than such a murder is.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: My worthy lord,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Your noble friends do lack you.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I do forget.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Do not muse at me, my most worthy friends,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I have a strange infirmity, which is nothing

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To those that know me. Come, love and health to all;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Then I'll sit down. Give me some wine; fill full.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I drink to the general joy o' the whole table,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And to our dear friend Banquo, whom we miss;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Would he were here! to all, and him, we thirst,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And all to all.

speaker: Lords
text_entry: Our duties, and the pledge.

speaker: Lords
text_entry: Re-enter GHOST OF BANQUO

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Avaunt! and quit my sight! let the earth hide thee!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thy bones are marrowless, thy blood is cold;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou hast no speculation in those eyes

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which thou dost glare with!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Think of this, good peers,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: But as a thing of custom: 'tis no other;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Only it spoils the pleasure of the time.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: What man dare, I dare:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Approach thou like the rugged Russian bear,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The arm'd rhinoceros, or the Hyrcan tiger;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Take any shape but that, and my firm nerves

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Shall never tremble: or be alive again,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And dare me to the desert with thy sword;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If trembling I inhabit then, protest me

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The baby of a girl. Hence, horrible shadow!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Unreal mockery, hence!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: GHOST OF BANQUO vanishes

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Why, so: being gone,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I am a man again. Pray you, sit still.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: You have displaced the mirth, broke the good meeting,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: With most admired disorder.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Can such things be,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And overcome us like a summer's cloud,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Without our special wonder? You make me strange

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Even to the disposition that I owe,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: When now I think you can behold such sights,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And keep the natural ruby of your cheeks,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: When mine is blanched with fear.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: What sights, my lord?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: I pray you, speak not; he grows worse and worse;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Question enrages him. At once, good night:

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Stand not upon the order of your going,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: But go at once.

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Good night; and better health

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Attend his majesty!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: A kind good night to all!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt all but MACBETH and LADY MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: It will have blood; they say, blood will have blood:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Stones have been known to move and trees to speak;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Augurs and understood relations have

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: By magot-pies and choughs and rooks brought forth

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The secret'st man of blood. What is the night?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Almost at odds with morning, which is which.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: How say'st thou, that Macduff denies his person

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: At our great bidding?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Did you send to him, sir?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I hear it by the way; but I will send:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: There's not a one of them but in his house

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I keep a servant fee'd. I will to-morrow,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And betimes I will, to the weird sisters:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: More shall they speak; for now I am bent to know,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: By the worst means, the worst. For mine own good,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: All causes shall give way: I am in blood

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Stepp'd in so far that, should I wade no more,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Returning were as tedious as go o'er:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Strange things I have in head, that will to hand;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which must be acted ere they may be scann'd.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: You lack the season of all natures, sleep.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Come, we'll to sleep. My strange and self-abuse

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Is the initiate fear that wants hard use:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We are yet but young in deed.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt
